qas.question: Approximately how many of the world population speak German as a native language?
Of the population that speaks German as a native language how many of them consider themselves to be German?
How many of the worlds population claim German ancestors?
what is the total number of Germans both native speaking and heredity in the world?
Where in Brazil is most of the German descendants located?

answers.text: mainly in the South Region of the country

qas.question: How many native German speakers in the world are there?
How many native German speakers consider themselves German?
How many people in the world claim to be from German ancestry?

plausible_answers.text: mainly in the United States, Brazil (mainly in the South Region of the country), Argentina, Canada, South Africa, the post-Soviet

qas.question: Where do an additional 80 million German natives live?
How many people single ethnic Germans are there in the world?

context: Of approximately <a0_0><a5_0>100 million<a5_0/><a0_0/> native speakers of German in the world, roughly <a1_0><a6_0>80 million<a6_0/><a1_0/> consider themselves Germans.[citation needed] There are an additional <a2_0>80 million<a2_0/> people of German ancestry <b8_0>mainly in the United States, Brazil (<a4_0>mainly in the South Region of the country<a4_0/>), Argentina, Canada, South Africa, the post-Soviet<b8_0/> states (mainly in Russia and Kazakhstan), and France, each accounting for at least 1 million.[note 2] Thus, the total number of Germans lies somewhere <a3_0>between <a7_0>100 and more than <b9_0>150 million<b9_0/><a7_0/><a3_0/>, depending on the criteria applied (native speakers, single-ancestry ethnic Germans, partial German ancestry, etc.).
